poem:
### Transition

In the streets,  
a murmur,  
green and thick—  
The world tilts,  
skyward glances  
trace heat  
like threads  
through air.  
Beneath  
all that was,  
roots unravel,  
holding fast  
to a promise  
murmured  
in half-waking  
dreams,  
our hands  
clasped tight  
around  
the heart  
of change.
